thread.title: Assembly sends bill ending secret investigations to Walker
thread.title_full: Assembly sends bill ending secret investigations to Walker

title: Assembly sends bill ending secret investigations to Walker
text:
Tune in to our newscasts streaming live at the following times: 
News 3 This Morning: Weekdays 4:30 a.m.-7 a.m.News 3 at Noon: Weekdays at NoonLive at Five: Weekdays at 5 p.m.-5:30 p.m.News 3 at 5:30: Sun. at 5:30â€¦ Assembly sends bill ending secret investigations to Walker Published On: Oct 21 2015 08:44:45 PM CDT Updated On: Oct 21 2015 08:49:21 PM CDT Channel3000.com file photo MADISON, Wis. - 
The Wisconsin state Assembly has sent a bill that would eliminate secret John Doe investigations into political misconduct to Gov. Scott Walker. Related Content Assembly committee to vote on blaze pink hunting gear bill 
The Assembly on Wednesday cast a largely procedural vote to get the bill to Walker. The Senate passed it around 1 a.m. Wednesday and the Assembly had passed it on Tuesday. 
Republicans are united in support of scaling back John Doe probes, while Democrats voted together against the measure. They say not allowing the investigations will lead to more corruption going undetected. 
Republicans say prosecutors can use other tools like grand juries. 
Walker has indicated his support for the bill in general, but not said definitively that he will sign it into law. 
Walker was investigated by two John Doe probes but wasn't charged in either one. 
Copyright 2015 The
